DOC.brief_title: Does Presence Preoperative Proteinuria Predict Postoperative Acute Kidney Injury Obese Patients Undergoing Elective Laparoscopic Surgery ?
DOC.detailed_description: Acute kidney injury ( AKI ) common , significant complication elective surgery associate increase risk mortality , major adverse cardiac event , prolong length hospital stay , increase cost per episode care . Obese patient increase risk postoperative AKI compare normal weight patient ; however current method assess preoperative renal function patient population ( measurement serum creatinine calculation estimate glomerular filtration rate ) previously demonstrate overestimate true renal function . , Preoperative proteinuria previously determine predictive development postoperative AKI patient weight undergo cardiac surgery . Published report prevalence proteinuria obese patient span wide range : 8- 43 % . The investigator aim determine predictive value preoperative proteinuria development postoperative AKI patient present elective laparoscopic bariatric surgery NYULMC . The investigator hypothesize preoperative proteinuria associate increase incidence AKI within 48 hour elective laparoscopic bariatric surgery . Furthermore , since wide range report prevalence proteinuria bariatric patient population , part value study provide definitive assessment prevalence proteinuria surgical population .
DOC.criteria: â‰¥ 18 year age Subjects undergoing elective laparoscopic bariatric surgery NYULMC , include gastric banding , sleeve gastrectomy , Roux enY gastric bypass Surgery schedule least one day Pre Admission Testing visit Preexisting end stage renal disease ( CrCl < 30ml/min and/or need hemodialysis ) Medical history systemic disease know cause proteinuria : monoclonal gammopathy , multiple myeloma , primary amyloidosis , diabetic nephropathy , acute myeloblastic leukemia , myoglobinuria , free hemoglobinuria ( i.e intravascular hemolysis ) Known pregnancy Diagnosis AKI within 6 month surgery Diagnosis cognitive dysfunction ( i.e . mental retardation/developmental delay , dementia , delirium ) Any subject study team feel would unable comply protocol procedure .
